str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Of Hebrew origin; a separatist, i.e. Exclusively religious; a Pharisean, i.e. Jewish sectary.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Apparently from ereo; to interrogate; by implication, to request.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Adverb from the base of pou; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way?; also as exclamation, how much!

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To look up, recover my sight. From ana and blepo; to look up; by implication, to recover sight.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To put, place upon, lay on; I add, give in addition. From epi and tithemi; to impose.
Clay, mud. Perhaps a primary word; clay.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: To wash; mid. I wash my own (hands, etc.). To cleanse; ceremonially, to perform ablution.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.
